Dialogue.Page: There you a… wait, how come you have your suit on already?
Geez, I guess you must be really eager to go! Well you're in luck: I just finished pre-flight observations, and local conditions are good.
And you’ll be our first astronaut ever equipped with a Nomai translator tool! I confess, I’ve been giddy all day just thinking about it.
We’re better equipped than ever to unravel the mysteries of the Nomai. You and Hal should be very proud of your work!
Tell me, what’s your plan once you’re in space?

DialogueOption.Text: I’m going to learn more about the Nomai.
I’ll meet up with the other travelers.
I want to go somewhere no one’s gone before.
I think I’ll start with something small.
Slate says the Sun is redder than usual.

Dialogue.Page: …Huh? Jeez, they've been spending too much time breathing in smoke fumes, haven't they?
Look, I've got bigger things to investigate than Slate's delusions. Tell them I said everything's fine so they'll get off my back, okay?
Whoa! You found a Nomai warp core! Geez, hatchling, that's pretty impressive!
And in such good condition, too… why, there's hardly even a scratch on it.
Tell ya what, hatchling. If you're willing to part with it, put it in the museum for me.
Anywhere is good for now; kinda busy at the moment. But don't worry, I'll make sure to put your name on the plaque.
Whoa! Nice catch, hatchling! Where'd you pick that up from?
Wanna place it in the museum for me? Anywhere is good for now; kinda busy at the moment.
But don't worry, I'll make sure to put your name on the plaque.
…What? Hatchling, did something go wrong with your ship? You felt that tremor too, right?
